Description: Fragment of wall of black-figured pottery open vase. Inside glazed; outside part of siren (neck and breast in faded white, part of wing with added red), overlapping cock (tailfeathers with dabs of red), both facing right.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Antikenmuseum, Heidelberg. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

The comment 'Chalkidisch' in CVA is perhaps unlikely in view of the overlap of the two figures. Heidelberg, Antikenmuseum I52-I77 and I85-I92 have in the past been erroneously known and cited as J52-77 and J85-92.
Bibliographic references: CVA Heidelberg IV / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Deutschland Heidelberg, Universität (p.50 pl. 166.5)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1051)
